intro: Tapeinosperma ligulifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leafed boxwood, is a shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Calycaraceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its compact growth habit and ornamental value make it a popular choice for hedges and landscape plantings. The leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
